snippet: Ina Drew “ascended to a level of power and wealth that few women have known” on Wall Street, Susan Dominus writes in The New York Times Magazine. Then she became the public face of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss, a blunder that...
abstract: Ina Drew “ascended to a level of power and wealth that few women have known” on Wall Street, Susan Dominus writes in The New York Times Magazine. Then she became the public face of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss, a blunder that cost Ms. Drew her job.
lead_paragraph: Ina Drew “ascended to a level of power and wealth that few women have known” on Wall Street, Susan Dominus writes in The New York Times Magazine. Then she became the public face of the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss, a blunder that cost Ms. Drew her job. “This is a scorching moment of failure from which it could be hard to recover.” Read more »

headline.main: The Rise and Fall of JPMorgan’s Ina Drew
